title: Operator Daily Maintenance of Crawler Tractors

tasks.task: Conduct daily pre-start check on a crawler tractor.
subtasks: Walk around the tractor to inspect for damaged or worn parts.
Check for fluid leaks in tracks, attachments, and hydraulic system.
Verify fluid levels (engine coolant, engine oil, hydraulic oil).
Drain fuel tank and clean air filtration system.

tasks.task: Perform equipment warm-up check before starting operations.
subtasks: Ensure all personnel are clear of the tractor.
Start engine and let it warm up.
Listen for unusual noises and check gauges (engine performance, functionality of attachments, braking, steering).

tasks.task: Conduct operating checks during daily operations.
subtasks: Monitor for unusual noises and engine performance.
Check track adjustment to prevent excessive wear.

tasks.task: Perform shutdown check at the end of the day.
subtasks: Park tractor on a level surface and secure attachments.
Idle engine for five minutes before stopping.
Record hour meter reading and refuel equipment.
Lubricate necessary points and clean debris from equipment.
